comment: his discussion are pretty easy and so are the quizzes but the writting assignments were a waste of time because the prompts were not enough for the word limit he gave. he doesn't give great feedback, he always said the same thing no matter what i changed, seemed like he was copy and pasting his feedback to all his students.

POLS 1101. Essays every other week, a textbook chapter to read each week which took me about 4hrs each time. He grades all written work harshly (I got many A's but never a 100), but the quizzes are MCQ and relatively easy. The content isn't that difficult, so it's possible to do well, but I wouldn't recommend.

comment: (PO 1101, actually) If you are a writer, do NOT take his class. Every other week there are writing assignments, that are 2 to 3 pages. He's a bit of a harsh grader and will take points off for trivial things. He also tends to personally email you on the day something is due if you haven't turned it in yet, which I found strange.

comment: There are a few major points to the class that are important to hit. There is a lot of reading ( ~700 pages worth), quizzes are 5 questions (easy as long as you read), and most importantly, enough extra credit to bump you up a whole letter grade. Dr. Crawford is very responsive and open to feedback. So far, the class has been very decent.

comment: Read 100 pages a week, have a quiz with just 5 questions, miss 2, get 60, repeat. Answers to quiz questions can be wrong. Fight him on his answers! Turn discussions in the day they open, not when they're due, or he won't give you full credit, seriously. He doesn't know how to communicate. This class uniquely frustrated me. Look for another one.
